metadata.title: In the Belly of the Beast

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you for your interest in our show and our audience, so for those of you who are interested, Loot Crate is a really cool service where once a month they bring you themed boxes that have mystery contents within that are part of that theme. All generally pop culture and geek-centric.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Taliesin, you're so loud!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Taliesin, quiet!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stop masturbating during the announcements.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so loud. What are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I hit my microphone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry. You're not an audio professional.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. At least it wasn't during a very climactic and important emotional moment in the game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) Yeah, that's right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're welcome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're a lot of fun, and if you go to their website at www.LootCrate.com/criticalrole and check it out. If you like it and you get a subscription, you can use criticalrole-- one word-- as a promo code to get $3 off a subscription.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm wearing some of the stuff from the crate right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And they've got a power crate coming out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: David Bowie! Labyrinth!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They have an Infinity Gauntlet oven mitt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty dope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that giving something away? I feel like we gave spoilers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was already Periscoped.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's true. Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be nice in the box. We're good? We didn't waste it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's in the box?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) A dick in a box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I hope there is no dick in a box as part of this service. Or perhaps I guess you do, depending on-- that's a whole different box service.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a love box membership. Anyway, so! Also, once again, I want to remind everyone, we are happily carrying along the torch of 826LA, a fantastic charity that's been with us from the very beginning. 826 is a wonderful charity that promotes creative writing skills and literacy in mostly underprivileged kids at a young age, at which they normally don't have access to tutoring and people to help them on that direction, so if you can and have the opportunity and you're feeling like giving to some awesome people out there, 826LA, and 826 in general in your area, is a great charity to take a look at, so please. You guys have been a tremendous help in the past and you may continue to be so, if you wish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good times. Let's see. Taliesin is joining us from Hawaii. Where are you at, Taliesin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're on Oahu. For Amazing Comic-Con.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're on Oahu and you're watching this, you should go say hi to him. Not right now, but tomorrow and Sunday. And the rest of the great folks that are out there with you. All good people. Big old Street Fighter troupe. Also, we have Travis and his nose goblin and Laura, you guys are attending Puerto Rico Comic-Con?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! We leave early tomorrow morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, you can sleep on the plane.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! If you're in Puerto Rico, come see us. We'll be there, totally sleep-deprived and bushy-tailed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a good one, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a good one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I went to that one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're excited to go. San Juan, baby. San Juan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's pretty slick, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does anybody else-- you said you wanted to mention something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look for the synth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think I play a synth. And there you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There you go. That's it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good plug.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can also build a Taliesin robot, which I did, and named it the Taliesin 2000.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, that's awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you could take either a custom-build Taliesin or me as your companion to Far Harbor and talk to these shmucks. And have a full Critical Role after-the-apocalypse experience. That's awesome. Okay, we're actually going to be downloading that soon. Anyone else have anything they want to mention before we jump into the game tonight?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's go ahead and get this started, as we dive into tonight's episode of Critical Role!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing's happening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No intro.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait! Let's act it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Act out the intro?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay! (imitating music)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (growls)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (swishing sound effects)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taliesin, do something!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shoot from your screen!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shoot, you're shooting your gun! Be Percy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then you got hit by a wang!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you fall over!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done Taliesin, that was great. Ashley picks him up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's healing him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll hold your hand! Eyes closed, holding my holy symbol!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it got weird.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Had to add it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And now it swings--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, Laura Bailey standing in for an orc! (stabbing sound) Ugh, gah! Now be yourself oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pew pew!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'll go oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I'll go oh! Then I wink at you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This was not the plan, for the love of god help us!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then I shoot another one at you! [actual intro plays]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now as part of this confrontation, they made their way to the city of Westruun, which was partially destroyed by the black dragon, Umbrasyl. While it was off and away with the rest of the Conclave, was then conquered by the wandering Herd of Storms that Grog once belonged to. After finding it occupied by these rather brutal barbaric individuals, Vox Machina set into the city, destroyed and tore down their leader Kevdak, to much fanfare from Grog's past. And through Kevdak's son and Grog's majestic might they decided to take the remainder of the Herd of Storms and take out Umbrasyl, the great black dragon. Half the Herd didn't like that and has decided to leave to their own devices, where the rest of the party possibly prepares to plot and plan a way to kill an ancient black dragon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't like the way he said that. Why'd you have to say it like that? It's just a black dragon!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else am I going to say?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why the dramatic pauses?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because it's fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You used the word 'somehow'.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I like it. You guys, having just finished this stroke of a conversation with Zanror in the Margrave's homestead, the dawn light is now beginning to pour over the mountain range in the distance. The day has officially begun. Zanror has stepped out and has begun to speak with a few of his trusted Herd members to stand down for the day, letting people know that the battle has been postponed for the time being while a plan is to be enacted, prepared for, and then sprung the following day. The rest of you guys have this day to prepare however you see fit. So I ask you: what would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have so many things that we need to do!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where do we begin?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need supplies. We need to parlay with our allies. We need lots of chains.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to trap the dragon obviously on the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For that we'll need some bindings of some sort: chains, hooks, spikes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a thought, I have a thought in that direction. When we're ready, I was thinking of basically building what is essentially a giant pressurized mousetrap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there, how would you do that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much time do you need, Perce?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I have access to some people to help build it, and some perhaps broken homes and chunks of wood and chain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have access to broken homes, chain, and scraps at your disposal. As far as individuals that can aid you, you have individuals that can help hold things for you. The Herd of Storms is not known for its ingenious use of tinkering tools, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about blacksmiths in town? Are there any blacksmiths left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can check around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a whole bunch of systems like this that will have chains and weights on them that when you disrupt the weight at the center the whole thing goes clunk, throws a whole bunch of-- it's basically a netting system. It's an entanglement and will be an entanglement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I'll tell you what. Go ahead and roll an investigation check, Percy, if you don't mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we help him at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'll say if you want to go ahead and aid to that, take advantage on that, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank god. Yeah, no, not very good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled a six.

lines.name: LAURA, MATT
lines.text: With advantage?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So! After taking the better part of about three hours scouring the town, most of the remaining villagers--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He took three hours doing that?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They have the materials to do very basic metalwork and ironwork, but the people you encounter, two folks in particular, they're both a little confused by your overall design and are waiting for you to lead them in a specific direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm just going to take them and I'm going to start building one and see if they can follow suit then. Three springs will be more than enough for this design.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How big a spring?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would say, how tall is this dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roughly 30 to 40 feet, depending.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Three two-to-three-foot springs made of solid iron. Just enough to lift the system and toss. And it's just, you make them like chainmail. It's a process that exists. I'm not going nuts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm not saying you're going nuts. You are a little stretched for supplies and manpower based on the circumstances in Westruun for a complicated task, but it's fairly possible, but it will pretty much take the entirety of your day and most of your night to prepare this. You'll be able to squeeze by with this, with the construction of the device, and have maybe just enough room for-- I'll let you squeeze in a long rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll be perfect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But that's success or fail.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What are the rest of you guys planning?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three hours ago, back when we were still together, I pulled Scanlan aside. Listen, I want to talk to you. I have an idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just give it a rest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're right, I should have never dragged you down into the sewers, and I apologize. It won't happen again. But listen to me. I have an idea. It's a dangerous idea, and I don't want to lead with it. I don't want to fight this dragon, to be honest, but I think the group is going that direction. If we do-- Percival's run off to try something, maybe we're just going to run out. I have an idea that only you can do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have a rod.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not the cube. A rod that cannot be moved.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could use it in some way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can teleport, and I'm almost too afraid to even suggest it, but if shit goes south, how would you feel about teleporting inside of Umbrasyl's stomach? With that rod.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, what has he eaten? Because it could be nasty in there!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I assume it will. I don't know anatomy. I haven't talked to my sister about this. She might be able to give us input, and I don't want to lead with this. I don't want you to do it because I feel like you could melt in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course I could melt in there! I'm a little man and he's got acid on him!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know. I'm looking for a way through this fucking clusterfuck and if there's nothing else to do, you could go in there and click that rod and give him the worst suppository ever invented!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen. If there's a man invented who can go to where shit is made and make some really good shit, that's me. So let's pursue this. As a plan B.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As a plan B. And I take him by the shoulders. You remember that little talk we had about a week ago, when you told--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this about Kaylie again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, we can talk about Kaylie in a couple of days, all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you told me how things were better now? Okay, you remember that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was fucking insane. They are not better. Everything is terrible! Our lives are terrible. They are way worse than they were six months ago, way worse. I was with all of you assholes a year ago, and two years ago, they're way worse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're saying that, a sullen loner who is confiding in one of his closest friends while holding him on the shoulders. This you never had before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slap him on the cheek a little bit and say: you are a fucking madman, but I am glad you're here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm glad to be with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I love you. And I give him a playful slap across the face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unexpected, sneak attack. 7d6 points of damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so I'm going to go talk to Vex. An expert in dragons I hope?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm an expert on dragons.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And ask her how dragons work, how their bodies work.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where they're vulnerable, where they make the acid, where they have lungs, where they have stomachs, how many stomachs? Are they like a cow with eight stomachs or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intelligence check with advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cows have eight stomachs?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They've got like two or three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up! 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Their stomach is quite acidic, as it has been known to dissolve some of the hardiest of creatures, let alone break down some basic minerals and materials. So it's not a happy place to be, but it's not like instantaneous dissolution. It will hurt. Also know that the breath weapon, the acid that a black dragon, which uses acid as a breath weapon in a stream in front of it, much like your lightning bolt, does not come from its stomach. That acid is much more toxic, concentrated, and comes from a separate part of its body, a gland, a breathing mechanism that projects it outward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's the gland located? Would I know that, like, in his throat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's somewhere in this vicinity, you're not entirely certain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So if I miss, end up in that gland, that would be not good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be really bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't roll a one!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But that would probably be really hard to just get right into that spot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you know, you wouldn't suffer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It would be instantaneous, at least.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also. Vex. Vex'ahlia.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Getting fancy now, Scanlan Shorthalt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Your brother tells me that you have some sort of acid-resistant something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The armor? That I took from him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, my armor. She has it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well-- are you here? Are you next-- are you next to me now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm about five feet behind you rolling my eyes and doing this the whole time you're talking about dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's the armor that I won fair and square from him! Yes, I am wearing it right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that your primary armor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How would you feel about me asking you to take it off? Doing a little unbuckling and giving it to me instead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, that's going to cost you a lot of money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could swap armor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You think your little armor will fit me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a pretty broad chest. These are pecs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of armor do you have?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have cold snap leather armor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which is cold resistant?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cold resistant. Maybe the dragon will throw snowballs at you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I doubt that. What is it, is it plus two?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus two on top of the armor, so it's four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's armor plus two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's better overall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Well sweet, then yeah, sure, give it to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Strip on down there, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, ladies first!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you first, I want to see the cube and then I'll give you my armor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shall we make it interesting and play a little poker?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no time for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you blow into this, are there strings? I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I try really hard not to start laughing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How are you going to take off your armor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good question. Do you want to walk away for this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I leave the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I completely ungracefully take it off and throw it at you. Give me that armor. How is this going to fit me? I'm just naked trying to squirm into these extra-skinny jeans.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, as you pull the armor pieces up, they shift and formfit to your size as part of their enchantment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What color is it? Is it beautiful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cold snap armor is I believe dark browns with traces of white and silver along the edges as a cold winter motif as part of the enchantment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it match my storm bow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I guess you could say that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You might not be getting this back, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, really? Well. What does mine look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For a moment, it looks pretty haphazard and hanging off of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the armor slowly retracts and finds itself to your form.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! They went down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In that moment, Scanlan learned a lot about himself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I feel good about this. Now we'll continue our dragon lesson I suppose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, why did you need to change-- are you going to be up close and personal with him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He breathes acid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yes, but.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, so we could get hit! Now I'm more protected than you are!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This was a really stupid-- why did I give that up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm very charming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now you're not here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You told me to leave! You took off your clothes. I'm Liam, I'm not Vax, what're you talking about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you planning on doing something?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll keep your armor safe. Hopefully we can trade back. And if not, you can peel it off my dead body.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As long as you're not melted from all the acid.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'd like to attune to my frostbrand sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, shit, I go running after Percival. I'm going to go find Percival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Well. Does that take an hour, or do I catch up with him pretty quick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes you about half an hour or so to locate him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, there's that white hair. Percival!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes? Hello. Bit busy. What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm sorry, I don't want to take up a lot of your time. I reckon you're going to be busy with this all day, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes. This is quite a project.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, and also tomorrow. You're probably going to be taking potshots at that thing, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah, that's my hope is to be, honestly, as far away from this as humanly possible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's probably not my plan. Can I have use of your blade?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! The dragonslayer longsword, yes, of course, of course. I pull it off my belt and hand it off. Could help. I'm a little terrified that you're getting that close to it, but here it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's just in case.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's quite a piece.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good luck today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good luck tomorrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am down to my normal sword now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I be talking to Zanror?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll join you in that. That was my next plan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zanror and Warra are in the process of piling weapons and armor with the rest of the Herd into the center of the town where the battle outside of the Margrave's house happened. Most of the warriors there are in the process of steeling themselves, some of them are gathering their materials, some are in the process of doing some minor ritualistic scarring in preparation for the battle. There is very little conversation happening. It seems like there is this quiet understanding that this, for many, might be their last day. They're making peace with the coming glory of battle. You'd expect this sense of tense fear, this very Battle of Helm's Deep-type acceptance of doom, but this is a different personality amongst the Herd here. There is almost a brimming excitement with the idea of possible glory or at least a glorious end. And it very much befits the story that you've heard of Grog's past history, and very easy to see where he once came from.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: MATT "Oh, good to see you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I stand behind Vex'ahlia.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This for me?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks to Worra.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't worry, we wouldn't try to poison you the night before a dragon-fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "That would be rather stupid, wouldn't it?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thanks."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Zanror? Did I hear you correctly before, that you have been the one speaking with the beast in the past?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have, aye."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So when it comes and gathers its treasure, it stops and talks, or does it just come and take it and leave?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It has at times. More at the beginning. If it had questions and seemed curious. That wore off "after the first few times. Now it just seems to come and take and find its way out."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So if the treasure looked different this time, it might stop and talk about it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He stops for a second. "Maybe."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm curious because I know you said you are lacking in gold and treasure. What will entice the beast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what is forcing our hand right now."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we had a way of providing some gold? And maybe you provide an offering of a different kind? What if you say that your father Kevdak had been plotting against the dragon and you found out about it. Would you be able to offer his body and the body of his allies as tribute to the dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Huh."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dragons are

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you do know specifically white dragons, or sorry, black dragons, they're very cruel by nature. They actually enjoy messing with creatures they see below them, especially intended prey, torturing for extended periods of time before killing. They aren't comparatively as vain as other dragons per se, but all chromatics fall in some way shape or form on that same scale of self-love to the point of being a near-disease to many of them. Zanror thinks to himself for a second and goes, "We can certainly try. I mean, I've got no more use for it, though it's going to "be hard to convince it without a head. I'm pretty sure Grog took that with him."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we may be able to get that back. How are you planning on hiding your fellow warriors from the dragon so as not to attract its attention? Because we may have some ideas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We'll have to share ideas. Ours was to go ahead and plod up Gatshadow. Usually it's about "noon when it comes down for the offering. We leave it what little we have left, possibly lose two "men in the process of delivering it, and then when it returned to its place we'd be there waiting to "ambush it once it returned, use that time when it was gone to go ahead and hole up inside its home."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That was our intent."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We might be able to do one better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A dragon's lair is not--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Especially a black dragon's lair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We wouldn't do much damage to it there, in fact, it's probably laid several traps against us already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, there's not much we can really do when we're all fighting with our fucking axes and "swords, can we? In the lair at least it's stuck on the ground."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we could trap it onto the ground here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How do you intend to do that?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a wonderful tinkerer. Quite talented. And he's creating something to trap the dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Really."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus we can provide several chains. Once it's on the ground, maybe your very strong goliaths could try to snare it, grappling-hook it, throw some chains up and over?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This pile of weapons you have here, I see a decent amount of javelins. A rudimentary harpoon, in the hands of some of your strongest, could help wrangle him down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He stops for a second and goes, "I just want to be clear we don't underestimate the sheer size, "strength, and ferocity of this beast. With all 20 men, we might be able to hold it down, I don't "know how long. I hope that contraption your friend is making is strong enough to aid us that last "little bit, because I get the feeling that if our might is put to just keeping it on the ground-- "well, that's a lot less of our strengths that we could be tending to. A lot less blades we could "put into its hide."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, hopefully it would only be needed for a small amount of time before our magic users have their way with it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: About that time I light up my hands.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's impressive. You know what else is impressive? Watching four of my friends melt in a "matter of seconds."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is very impressive. You're not wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now. I've got chains, you've got chains. We've got "strong men. If we put ourselves intent on just holding this beast down, I have the feeling, even "with our weight behind it, it's going to be a difficult attempt. Do we have any other way of "anchoring it down, something else we can put the chains to?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: About that time I walk over to the-- is there a stone wall in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there are pieces of stone building in the vicinity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I put my hand against the stone and I cast Transmute Rock and I push my hand into the stone as it turns to mud.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And now turn it back, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take a spear that's on the floor, stick it in, and then turn it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Let me look this up real fast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Put my hand underneath the spear. Put my hand over the spear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah? Ah? No strings!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where is it, where is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, mud to rock, yeah. Lasts for-- it's instantaneous. So when he looks at that, he goes, "So. What you're saying is if we can find a few places in which the rock is close to the surface, "you could lock these chains in?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I could lock the whole dragon in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Once it's on the ground, if we can pull it down enough, she may be able to lock its legs into the stone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beyond that, if that fails-- And then I cast, for right now I'll just do Wall of Stone, I'm just burning through all my spells as a demonstration. And I bring up two pillows. Two pillows?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And then we all lay down and go to sleep!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pillow fight! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Billy Mays here for the Ashari Tribe!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Goose down. Unexpected tactic."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like how we're walking through all of these ideas and none of it's going to work when we get there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I blast up two pillars, right next to Kevdak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not next to Kevdak. You mean Zanror?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, sorry. Sorry, the other big goliath leader.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whatever your name is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one, ohmygod.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And trap him in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you (rumbles). Warra's pushed to the side as the stone shoots up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Sorry, Warra, sorry. So-- I know! Did not mean to lay a hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, your point is made. We've got two others who can do similar magic as you, maybe "not the same level, but--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fantastic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Want us to put them at your aid?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That would be wonderful. Beyond that, in prep, I can dig a trench, hidden underground around our trap, so that whenever we're ready, your army can bust out of the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Surprise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Without being seen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Without being seen, what, are we going to bury my men?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Very lightly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pretty much. To be fair, I actually did it on a trap to kill like eight of your men on the way in and it worked phenomenally. So you should trust me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was pretty great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It worked well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think we'll take our chances above ground, please."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The only thing I'm worried about, Zanror, is that if this ugly beast flies in and sees, oh, how many of your men do you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Currently we're sitting at 25 total, including myself."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 25 men standing around. Don't you think it's going to be a little curious as to why all of the sudden-- all of a sudden? There's a large number of people around, that's never been there before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're asking me this, our plan was to go inside while it was out. But if you want us there, "let's figure out a way to hide, then. I don't think my men are going to like to be "underground."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It'll be very spacious. It'll be a nice big tunnel, it's not going to feel like you're buried alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And what, they just leap out one by one through an opening?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It'll be super shallow. Just enough that they can come on up and out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It'll be awesome, it will look like they're coming out of the grave. They'll look like badasses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't think that's going to really get a dragon shaking in its claws, y'know?" (sighs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not a lot is going to get a dragon shaking in its claws.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me talk to my men. We'll see what we can do, we can muster as far as these chains go."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A surprise attack is going to be one of our best shots at grounding this thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So, am I to tell my men we're going to bury them in the ground?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not bury them, that sounds so dramatic when you say it like that, I mean I'm going to make a tunnel, there'll be stairs, they'll be able to walk freely, they'll have air holes, it'll be just like when you moved through the sewers to not be seen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll talk to them. I certainly hope your magic stone-shaping is as strong as it is. At the "very first moment that dragon looks like it's going to go ahead and break free, we're weapons "out. You do understand that."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We would appreciate that, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We want it to land, then we strike. We just want it to hit the fucking ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. And what's our bait? You say you have some gold to give?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some gold to give.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Try for Kevdak's corpse-- I hope that's enough. I'll see what else we've got left in our "coffers." He turns around and him and Warra walk away, a couple of the men join them and they--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I actually-- I go over to Warra real quick before she walks away? Just to her side, and say, you look well. Have the Seers told you if it's going to be a boy or a girl yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not yet. But if we survive this, I have a feeling I'll know. The strength and glory of this "fight will confirm."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you survive this fight, I'm pretty sure you'll bear the strongest child anyone has ever known.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The stallion that mounts the world, for sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There it is, there it is. It's in all our heads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What could possibly go wrong? She looks over her shoulder at Zanror as he's walking away and goes, "Could be." And she just turns and starts walking with him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we really need to dig a trench.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to start digging a trench.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Around the area that the treasure is going to be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys scope it out, it's northwest of the town, you saw it on the way in, and it's very easy to make out at this point because there have been large claw-marks in the ground, there are broken pieces of wood, there's a shattered cart, there's some barrels that are partially destroyed to the side, there's a little bit of leftover ends and pieces that fell out of whatever it picked up as it took off as well as a smattering of copper, silver, and gold pieces that you rummaged through before when you first came to the town. But there's a definitive place that you recognize where this drop point is, it's out in the open in the field, there's going to be a couple of nearby rocks, a handful of trees, but they're all very sparse and spread apart. Other than that, it's just open field, so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away is the nearest tree cluster?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To that, it's about-- tree cluster? I mean, most of the trees that are here are singular, there's two trees that are within ten feet of each other and that's maybe 80 feet away from it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When you dig the trench, can I use my perception and my ranger ability to camouflage things and make sure that from above the ground, from the height that the dragon will be looking at it, that it's not seeable at all? I don't want this trap to be seen-- I guess I should wait until we find out if Percy finishes his trap and gets it in place to do all of this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that if you'd like to. Yeah, as far as the camouflage ability--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know Hide in Plain Sight is for myself, but I feel like as a ranger I'd be able to hide tracks and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say we can certainly give you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can use a little Dust of Tracelessness or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have anything illusion-based that could even just help tidy up before. You do know that dragons are very perceptive creatures and are very-- are not very trusting either. They're paranoid. That is part of their narcissism, so anything you can use, whether it be illusion, camouflage, anything to hide any sort of possible chance of it not trusting this scenario you're going to want to do, otherwise this thing might fly overhead and notice one thing and be like ah, peace! So. Be warned. Miss Dragon Specialist.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was all knowledge in your head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know all of these things! All of a sudden!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did he just say dragons have really high perception so don't fuck with anything and make it look weird?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he said if we're going to do it, make sure it is hidden.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. Make it look real good. Right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go up to some of the guards outside and say, oi. Where do you keep your prisoners, hostages, meat shields?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there are no real guards of Westruun anymore, most of the guards that--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I meant like the goliath, the Herd guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ones who were before and the few we did keep, "well, those we chained up or executed, but there were a few that were thrown in there."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any still in there? Or are they all clear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, there's plenty of prisoners still in there, we didn't touch the prison, mostly."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hm. All right, thank you. (whispers) What was Reginald's daughter's name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if I wrote it down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wrote it down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to make my way over to the Iron Stocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And you've been here before, you know the Iron Stocks, although you weren't sure if it was being used as still a prison. And seemed loosely, just throwing a handful of people in for use later on that never quite came to fruition.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know her name either. We might not have known a name.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought we knew her name. Reginald's daughter's name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you remember her name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you asking me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What Sam wrote, he just wrote down 'Reginald's daughter'.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe he never told us her name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right, you make your way to the Iron Stocks. And it is currently unguarded, there is nobody there, the Herd has lost interest in it, the door's partially ajar, and as you walk inside you can already smell the place just reeks of refuse and decay. It looks like everything left in the middle of a workday. There are still ledgers open on the front desk, you can see what looks to be a small group of-- a barracks-type scenario to the left of the entrance that is just completely abandoned and looks like some cases are left open, scattering various keepsakes and bottles that are shattered on the ground, a lot of people left either to go into battle to defend against the dragon, to lose their life in it, or just to get the hell out of Dodge.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I walk up to the ledger and pretend to read it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You pick it up and leaf through for a few pages, lotta great squiggles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some pretty handwriting, you can tell--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any squiggles that look familiar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Um, no. No, none that-- I mean, some look familiar, some are more rounded--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, this poor bastard right here, yep, I remember him, good chap. Hello? Is anyone in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a slight pause. Then you hear a voice echo from the right side of the room, down a hall just through the stone, you can barely make it out because the distance it's at, because you're hearing the echo protrude from quite a distance, but a voice just says, "Hey! Hey! In "here! Need food please!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit. So I go in that direction. Open the door and try and make my way that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You come to a set of stairs that leads down into the next subterranean region and you hear the voice again, much closer, be like, "Hey! Hey! I "hear your footsteps!" And you see a hand reaching out from behind some of the bars.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Put your hand back inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hand retracts as you look over.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a good lad. What's your name? Before I approach. Still far enough away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah. Orn. Orn Finch at your service. Been in here far too long and very thirsty. I will be "happily at your service, fair muscled man, should you see fit to relinquish me from these binds." And you look at him, he looks like a lowly beggar, longish tattered hair, wearing just general tattered and soiled clothing, no shoes, feet look blistered and black.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ugh. I'm going to call you Orn Blackfoot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Blackfoot it is, Orn Blackfoot at your service, if you could just--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My name is Lord Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lord. It is my pleasure." And he reaches through and grasps your hand, his fingers are bony and thin, and he takes it and shakes it with what little strength he has.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Man, you are looking a little rispy-- Pour out a little ale into a goblet, and I give him a goblet of ale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He snatches it from you and slurps into it, extremely thirsty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ah-ah, not too fast, not too fast, don't want to get the bubbles. And I reach into the Bag of Holding and I have a dry food ration. I have three left. Now I have two. And I give him some dried food ration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes it and eagerly starts jamming it into his mouth. As he's eating, he's not even talking at you, this is just sheer hunger, the need to survive has taken over and he's just cramming it in there, choking a couple of times, keeping himself okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pace yourself, lad. Tell me, why are you in here, Orn Blackfoot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, well, this is-- everyone just started yelling and they abandoned us all here. It's been "terrible hearing the moans and screams going silent. I thought they abandoned us all."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, they did, to be clear. They totally abandoned you. You are really the only person I know of that's in here. All the other mates around you, they're either sleeping or, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate the food and drink, you've certainly done--" At which point a voice comes from about two cells over behind you that goes-- "Did I hear food and drink?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Food-- food and drink, please. Please."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Orn, did you kill all those dried food rations just now, did you just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see him very discreetly pocket some in his robe. "Oh, everything you gave me is gone, I'm "sorry, friend."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Man, what an appetite. Do you mind regurgitating a little like a momma bird into my hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I walk over to see where the other voice is coming from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you turn around the way, there is the next set of bars, you see behind there a man in his forties, also extremely thin and gaunt, reddish long thin beard, long unkempt brownish red hair that is just crimped up around the base of it, like it's just gone almost into dreadlock territory from how long he's been in there and mistreated. You can see dried blood at the corner of his mouth. He looks up at you. "Sir, if you would be s-- Grog?" And the moment of recognition hits you, this is Abjurist Noja, whom you previously-- (yelling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Abjurist is a very powerful-- he has knowledge of the arcane and stuff, right, he was--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was the guy who saved us! He saved us when the white dragon came to Westruun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was frozen in ice. That guy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I found us Boba Fett, sweet!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks pretty wrecked right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, give him food, Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Abjurist Nosebleed, hold on real quick, look. And I take the other, the second to last dry food ration, I give him that, and I give him a thing of ale, I'm like, I'm sorry, it's really dry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you, friend, thank you very much."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah, you're very welcome! Hold on. Is there anybody else in this hallway before I give away my last bit of food?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear two voices simultaneously down the end of the hallway come in, one of which is a very weak female voice, the other is a very loud kind of-- "Hey, bring me food this way, please!" The other one is like, "Please, I ask of you, I'm starving." And you see these two hands come out of the two cells in the distance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, I'm going to pick a number between one and ten. Ready? Go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's an awkward pause. "Three?" "Seven! Definitely seven!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I lean over to Abjurist Noja, I say, I actually don't know any numbers, so. Y'know what, we're going to deliberate and we'll be with you in just a moment. (whispers) Abjurist, how old y--, why are you in here, who put you in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got in an altercation in my store when these "brutes started walking in. Threw me in here, didn't even let me take my spellbook."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that is a crime. I love b-- I can't even say it. Hold on, stay right there, I'll get you out-- And I walk back to Orn Blackfoot, I go, look, hey, so I gave you food, can you do anything, like, special?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like, can you make your hands turn to flame, can you disappear, are you really good with a bow and arrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! No." And he reaches out and grabbing at your clothes though and starts pulling you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey! Orn, chill!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can, I can get you things. I can make "connections--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but most of the people in here are dead, right, like they're probably not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And Lansway, just name it and get me out of here and I can--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How long has it been since you've been to Emon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Few months?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got any loved ones there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know, just asking, like, do you want me to take a note from you to them or something, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, if you can release me, I'd be more than happy to take it myself if you don't mind."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I try and find any-- is there a lever on the wall to release the cells or can I look for keys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You-- make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Minus two for a 17!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ah! All righty. So. After spending the good part of an hour or so clamoring through, just throwing bookshelves over and (crashing) taking the desk and actually throwing it onto its back and pulling drawers out, this is Grog's method of investigation here, you're just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just trying some splinters of wood in the locks just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. You break off a few forks in some locks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Forks, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In practice, yeah, whatever looks small enough and should fit, though it doesn't, but you make it fit. And it doesn't help. You do eventually find in one of the cells, closed and locked as you look by, there is one person in guard armor, in Westruun guard armor, that is in the cell. Not moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey. Hey, you. I kick him in the back a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No movement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I kick him harder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No movement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I look down the hallway. I back up a few steps. And I really run up and kick him really hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He just lurches over onto the side. Not moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you're dead. Can I pat him down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you reach in and you can smell the decay starting to set in. And as you get close you can reach through the bars and see him, the actual area is closed and the door appears to be locked, and inspecting the body very quickly you can see that he was stabbed multiple times from behind and probably left in here to bleed out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Low perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you do find on him what appears to be a ring of keys. Not directly on his body, but underneath the corpse, like he was-- you gather best you can, someone probably grabbed it, got their way out, used that moment to stab him and escape.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice! I take the keys and I jauntily run by Orn Blackfoot and I go to Abjurist-- Hey, do you know who those other two voices are at the end of the hallway? Like, did you have anyone with you when you got put in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, no one with me. Although-- been plenty of angry discussion from that dwarven fellow down "the way."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, he's got a really rough accent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can hear you!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. My voice carries. Are you all right here for one minute? I have to go perform an interview real fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm all right." And he just finishes eating the little bit of the ration that you gave him, like dried meats and bread.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, sit tight. All right, you two, put both your hands outside the cell where I can see them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both put their hands out. The dwarven man you can see puts his hand out, the skin is very wrinkled and you can see the varicose veins on it, the arm hair that you see on the dwarven arm is white, like bright white. The female hand comes out is thin, but the skin looks a little softer and younger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Female elven, or is this female--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The daughter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who said three?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, the dwarf voice goes, (incoherent semi-cursing).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, look, it's always lucky number three, right? That's what they say. Who says that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Racist little-- peh!" And the arms just withdraw, and the woman, "That's me, that's me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh good. Hi. You look nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look down, you see a young woman, maybe in her late teens, early twenties, long brown hair, tangled, covering one half of her face. You can see the edges of her lips are cracked from just dryness and lack of moisture. She's wearing, both of them actually are wearing just these long, simple cloth drape-over robes that are just, y'know, for any prisoners in here that need to not be wearing their normal clothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got three other goblets left, can I both give them a goblet and some ale, just to wet their lips and get a drink in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They eagerly take it and begin scarfing it down, the dwarf's like, "Oh! That's nothing!" You can look at the dwarf now, he's elderly, crotchety, half-blind, one clouded eye, but for being a man who's been stuck in prison and slowly dying, he's got this wry grin on him at all times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're turning away good ale. Looks like you've seen many a moon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're telling me that. But no, seriously, that's like half full. Come on, don't be stingy!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like your gall. And I pour more ale in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's the ticket!" It's like spilling on the sides and getting stuck in his bright, bushy white beard, and each bit that dribbles down, he goes-- catches it and then pushes it back in, not wasting a single drop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beautiful. If you don't mind, ladies first, love, what is your name? Why are you in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's Amelia. I was taken because they were-- the beasts were dealing with an uprising "from some of us farm folk and, well, they took me as leverage in the argument. Stopped their-- "stopped their arguing."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're-- you're farm folk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have any family?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are their names?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's my father Reginald."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, I had a bit of split pea soup that's just disagreeing with me, it's all right. Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are they okay, have you seen them? Have you seen any of the people out there?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I-- we should get you out of here, there's really bad stuff going on outside, we're trying to get everyone out of the town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you hear a voice down the way say, "Everyone out of the town? That sounds like a "great plan." And the dwarf behind you is like, "Well then, get us out! I'm sick of this cell!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold on. Can I try the keys on Amelia's cell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm. You go through the keyring, which probably has a good 40 or so different keys on it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And so you go through one, two, three, four, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six, six, six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) And what would be the late teens, and for what to you seems like forever, one key does (squeaking) in the lock and it opens. She, who's been like sitting down the whole time, stands up weakly and grabs the bars and pulls herself up and waits for you to let her through if she does, just being patient.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very brave. Not sure where he is, but we're going to get you out of the city, just stay put for a moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, you, you salty bastard, what's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Old Davin. What's your name?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lord Grog. Emphasis on the Lord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lord Grog."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lord of?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Vales of Strongjaw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll take it, that's fine. Get me out, please?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Oh, keys. Can I take the keyring and can I pry the metal keyring-- is it like one solid piece or is it the kind that I could maybe bend it open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, it is one solid piece that has been looped twice, but it has been-- the iron itself has been bent around itself to make it nice and tight, form-fit on one end. Go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ping. (laughs) Like, you were preparing yourself for a full pull, and with but a minor twitch of your muscles it just bends open.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I take half the keys and give them to Amelia and say, love, would you go and let out the kind gentleman with the reddish beard and the little blood on his mouth named Abjurist, would you try these keys and see if his cell will open? Not yet for Mr. Blackfoot across the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. I will, I will." She rushes off and starts fumbling through the keys, and you hear in the distance her making her way through the keys as--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take the other half and start trying to get Da-- what was his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Old Davin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Old, I like old.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have we met Old Davin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not met Old Davin, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Davin, what did you get put in here for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right if I know! Got real drunk and woke up in here, everyone started screaming and running "away, and I'm like ahh, run away you pansies, and they did, ran away, they never came back. Some "packed fire, but not a problem now." And yes, the one snowblind eye doesn't move at all, the other one glances around, that one's completely stuck in a forward position.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that magic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, certainly gets the ladies."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But no, it's a reminder to not, well, to not mess with your people."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Well, I'm sorry to hear that. But they do make you look very young.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Much worse, say I."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now if we let you out of here, right, which we're actually in the process of doing, what is your weapon of choice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, oh." And he thinks to himself for a moment. "I would have to say my weapon of choice "would be Bloodvine ale. Aye."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bloodvine ale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye, if we're picking poison, that's my favorite."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, my-- He's a dwarf, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Obviously we are brothers of the beard. Like, to fight with, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, that kills, eh?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, stab, poke, enchant, whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Once upon a time I was quite a duelist, so if you got something pointy and prickling I can "spear 'em with the best of them."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do have a Greatsword of Frenzy, but it's a two-handed weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, that's not my preference."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do also have one regular, just a regular longsword. About the best I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, that'll do, certainly, I'll take a longsword."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, so. Have I got the door open yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet. But at this time there's an awkward pause and now you're like, don't have any more conversation. But you still have to finish the-- about a minute later, he's sitting there going, "Come on, come on, come on." Eventually-- tink!-- it opens up. "Yes!" And he pushes it open as you pull it open.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before I give you this sword--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: --are you up for the fight of your life?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I insight check him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is going to go really well. Eight! Nine!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go Tarv, go Tarv.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems a little--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems a little malnourished, and a little confused.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But nothing sets you off as untrustworthy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, your expression says a lot. What if I put an excellent meal in your belly, sharpened that sword some more, would you like to fight for some glory come the morrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure. Why not?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I thought. If you would go join Amelia, I have to get my good friend Abjurist Noja out of his cell and then we're going to go have a meeting, because there's going to be a big feast tonight, it's going to be delicious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where's it happening?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, it's very secret, yep. Secret location, TBD.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, right. I'll wait for you." And he walks out, taking the keys from you as he runs off toward Amelia.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now, has she gotten Abjurist out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There goes Taliesin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Man, I know a lot of people that are going to be really, really happy to see you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah. Really? Well, I'm very happy to see these people, anybody really, that're not the "inside of this blasted prison." (coughs) (Skype rings)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, get him, get him!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Quick, answer it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stupid tinkerer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying, I'm trying!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival and his technology.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. Welcome back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I ask you a question? So I have this new axe, right, it's really nice. I got it off the leader of goliaths, real prick. It's really strong and I've known about it for years, there's nothing, like, funny about-- Actually, if I give this to you, would you just tell me if you, like, hear anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, they took my spellbook when they threw me in here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If we could find that, maybe I can help you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That makes sense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Otherwise, I'm out of tricks, friend, sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. I turn around to Orn Blackfoot and I'm like, "All right, mate. Last chance. Why "should I let you out?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because I can be a good friend and help you out. I can get you money and women and travel "anywhere you wish."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've done all three of those things more than most men do in three lifetimes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And you can have a fourth! Please, just let me out of here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm thinking of a number between one and three.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's like only one of a couple that I know. All right. You get to come out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, wonderful. Thank you, thank you, thank you. And I'm a man of my word, don't you worry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I insight check if he's a man of his word?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll better. Shit fuck balls ass. Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I start looking for the key to his cell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. At this point, you've run through the ring enough, you can go ahead and take it from Old Davin. Over time you eventually get him free, and as soon as you do, he stretches, cracks his back a bit. "All right. Thank you kindly. So. Let's be off." And he charges up next to Noja and then breezes past them and you guys all exit the outside of the Iron Stocks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look for Noja's book, look for Noja's book.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah, well. Noja, Noja, is there a location where your spellbook was last? (belches)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know where they would have put it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, well, goliaths are awfully fond of books. Let's go find out, shall we? And we go back towards where I guess everybody last was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. On the way there, Noja's like, "I do have one of my older spellbooks, wouldn't have all "of my materials, but that would be back at my shop if we ever have a chance to stop by."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, we could go there now if you'd like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Certainly."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far is it from here? I forget, it's been a few years.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, it's about-- just due east of where the temples are, about 25, 30 minutes up that way."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold that thought. I grab my earring and I say, can anybody hear me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, yeah, the Stocks aren't too far. Whoever's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's up, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, so. What if I told you I found somebody's name that rhymes with Daburish Koja?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You found Dabney Coleman?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dabdrist Cojo?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's Abjurist Noja.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, I didn't realize 'til now how many people we actually know whose name rhymes with that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we're like really important.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we know a lot of people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I'm going to take him to find his spellbook, because I feel like he could be a great--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't recall this person.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Weren't you with us, Percy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Percy met him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was I?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, remember the guy who saved us at the first Winter's Crest festival?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes, no, he was quite lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, he's very nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I found him. I'm going to get him a spellbook. Does anybody want to come with, or are you all good?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm about to dig a trench, so I'll pass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, where are you right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Heading northeast towards, northwest, northwest. Sorry. It's noon, it's hard to tell in the sky right now. Northwest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you with us, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike's with us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm done attuning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the attunement takes about an hour or so, half an hour to an hour.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I just found you guys, just hanging out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, what's up. You want to help us clear some stuff?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You need some help? Yeah, let me help you, I'm so strong.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Um, Grog, I can come with you, Grog, if you need some help.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. The cube is always welcome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My. Goodness. Gracious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Um.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? So, Scanlan, if you want to come meet us, we're over by the Iron thing. How would I tell him where we are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Iron Stocks, you can describe it to him and eventually he'll find his way there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm over by this thing balalalala.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Excellent description, I'm on my way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) And you've been to the town before, you guys have spent some time in Westruun, so you know the basics around. So you manage to meet up with these fellas and you make your way northward into the outskirts of Noja's shop. Noja's shop is untouched by the battle, it seems, still stands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shit. Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He walks up and the door's open and looks inside and just sighs heavily, as the interior of this place has been picked clean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, son of a fucking-- looters!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Noja, were there any hidden compartments or secret safes where you kept the good stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Yeah, most everything of worth appears to have been taken or broken.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Search around, help him search!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, is there anything we can help you find that you're looking for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Anything intact, really."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, can we help him look for any vials, or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Better. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do find two, one of which is a yellowish fluid that's streaked with black swirls, and there is one that it's like a clear liquid that has a-- the liquid itself fills the vial and then shrinks down to a tiny bead and then expands again to fill the vial, like a very, very slow heartbeat. Those are the two that you find.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yellow with black swirls, and then a clear potion that--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, he'll just tell us, I assume. Sir, we're about to embark on a deadly adventure to try to clear this town so that you can once again live here safely. Might we trouble you to borrow these potions if they can be in some way helpful to us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've done me great service by getting me out of that hellhole. You are welcome to take "these with you for now. I guess I have to start from scratch..."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know what they are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, yes, I'm sorry, I'm sorry." And he takes the vials and looks at them. "Ah, this is a "Potion of Diminution. It shrinks you to a smaller size."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I could be small! Oh, wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It only lasts for a few hours, depending, the magic isn't perfect, but it does make you "smaller. This other one, this vial contains a liquid that will make you quite speedier. It will "increase your metabolism for a short time, the world around you seems to slow, it's quite "effective."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you so, so much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah actually, have you ever seen this shrinking potion work, like, how small does something get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pretty small. Like, if on your size--" And he makes a shape of about that big.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So teeny-tiny.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For you, yes. For you, you'd be about his size."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That would be the best thing ever. Now that you've found-- I'm sorry, go ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No no no. This is most helpful. Do you know anywhere also around here where we might pick up some chains, hooks, spears, javelins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, those are not my forte, my apologies."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should've took those from the prison.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, check a general goods store, perhaps?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, this is so helpful, thank you, let me go get those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So here are your potions.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That book that you got, it's not your favorite, right, the one that was hidden above the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, no, but it'll do, at least. Do you wish me to inspect that weapon for you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, would you mind? I've never done that before, but the last one I had talked to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's... unsettling. That's very unsettling."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, among other things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it fades, he goes, "Hm. Well, if what you worry about is the presence of some sort of sentience, I "can assure you, you need not worry. This is merely a tool, and a powerful one at that." And he begins to tell you what it does, which is exactly what you already know after attunement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No long card coming? (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Son of a bitch. Thank you, Abjurist, you are as wise as you are. Old.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Old? (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm only 48, but thank you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's lost on me. Do you need anything else?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll pick up what pieces I can."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should you get-- should we tell him to get out of the city or fight with us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I was going to ask, you do know what is beset upon this city, right? The horrible calamity that's coming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I saw the dragon tear through, yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We aim to finish the dragon, maybe even tomorrow, and make Westruun free once again. Would you have any interest in aiding us in this fight, or are you past the point of putting up a brave battle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see him standing there, even just standing here this time, his knees are wobbling a bit, and he goes, "I'm afraid I wouldn't be of much aid at this moment without my proper "spellbook. I have a few child's treats at my disposal." And he sifts through a few pages and he seems to-- the book looks like it's pretty old, like probably his training manual when he first began to study as a practitioner of the magical arts. "I don't know how much use I'd be, "unfortunately."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The day's still young. What say we give, like, a solid effort to finding your bigger books, and then if you can't find it and you can lend no aid to us, we'll make sure you find yourself safely on your way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. All right, fair enough. Well come, let us look. Perhaps we should give another "once-over of the rather seemingly destroyed interior of that prison."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
