lines.text: Looks like Amelia and Old Davin have nothing else better to do, they begin to aid you for a bit, although Amelia is eager, and mentions the possibility of going and checking in on the farmsteads on the outside of town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. About that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orn? Orn Blackfoot? Gone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, figured that much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He has peaced.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys take a moment, and when you start deciding what to do, and you look around and he's just gone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought you had him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What'd you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was watching you, you have disgusting black feet. You walk around barefoot, you're disgusting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take it later. Yeah, so can we go back to the prison, not to take away from everything else, and maybe look for chains, like some hooks, maybe some broken bars?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. The two of you guys, make one more investigation check, this'll signify the next few hours of looking for the things you want.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, roll really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Between the two of you, working into and past dusk, you manage to acquire quite a number of chains. It's funny, a prison seems to have a lot at their disposal. They have a queue of chains that are used of various lengths, some of them may have to be put together to make the length of which you're looking for, but between ramshackle manacles to just lengths of chain that are used to opening gates and used to seal elements of the subterranean portion of this prison, you manage to acquire quite a bit. You do, towards the end of the evening, manage to find partially destroyed remnants of Noja's spellbook. He seems a little disappointed as soon as he sees the state it's in, a lot of the pages have been burnt and torn out of these--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, it's all right, there are some here that are of use to me. And if I can be of any "assistance tomorrow in this fray, hopefully at a distance-- How big is this dragon, you said?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it's like seven feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, well then I can definitely be of help there, not a worry, all right. I'll prepare myself "best I can."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. We'll make sure, we'll keep you on the outsides with those that are not, you know, can't take a good walloping.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have any healing potions or anything, or I mean, I'm sorry, healing spells?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not my specialty, I fear, and the potions I had are now soaking in the floorboards "of my humble shop."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not that I would understand, but could you tell us what your specialty is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Abjuration, of course. That's the school of magic of which my--" (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm familiar with that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Abjur--yeah. Mm-hmm. No idea what that means.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like Claymation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, like puppets. I'm a big fan of puppets.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, well, we'll get some rest, try to put the pieces of your place back together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will. Come to me when the time is ready to face this fiend, this foul creature, and I'm "happy to help."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, we should probably make him a part of the feast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll come get you later tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to track down the women after talking to them over the earring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Straight from Percival, once I catch sight of them, can I talk to you for a minute?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a minute, I know you're busy. Um.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's super busy, brother!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, two minutes. Two minutes. Um.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So busy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thanks, Stubbs. You're way more powerful than I am, and I don't know what I'm going to-- (Skype noise)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: God dammit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's that sound?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many noises happening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're going to be doing a lot more damage than I am tomorrow, it's not like I'm going to run up and stab the thing in the back. I feel like you're probably going to be too busy to be using Fassbender--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do you want Fassbender? I was actually going to offer him to you, 'cause I feel like you might--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think I want to be of use, so yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm pretty sure you don't have to worry about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gagging)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it just goes on the head, then how does it work, what do you, what do I talk to it or do I think it or what do I do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you give it a command, it takes your full concentration to give it a command, and then once you do that it will enact that plan until it's complete or until you tell it otherwise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And if you wanted to cast a Slow spell, just, you have to focus and tell it to do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Do I say like, slow?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I don't know. Just wing it. I kept talking to him like it was a person and I don't think that's necessarily the way to go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe I'll prac-- where did you park him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's still in Scanlan's mansion.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that still there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, based on the time that spell was cast, the 24-hour duration has expired. All things in the mansion have been jettisoned from the doorway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Including your grandad!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So he's in Wilhand's house, with Wilhand.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Great, well, I'll take that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Hopefully Wilhand's watching over him right now, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It might have destroyed the house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kiki.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes? (Skype noises)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (Taliesin makes noises on Skype) (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think he's eating popcorn, or maybe opening a butterscotch candy in the theater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't even see you guys, are you like?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he went away! Aw, this is just not--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, really quickly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Well, at least he started.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes? This seems to happen all the time, every time we try to talk to each other. I don't think I've really, continue, continue. It's hard to have a conversa--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continue, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hello, yeah, Percival, I'll talk to you in a minute, all right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shut up, Percy. Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It wasn't fair, last week. It wasn't fair to you. And I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In your room, in your room. Me leaving wasn't--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When you left me, right--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: --wasn't fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah yeah yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's it. I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry if I dropped that on you, and put any more undue stress, that's not what I want--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is awful, all of it is awful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe this can be a fine partnership. A fine endeavor to do with her, and then once we save the world and we retire and some other young prodigies come forward to save the world again, then we can thank her for her services and move on. I don't think we'll always need her. I don't think you will always need her. And, keep in mind, the one true thing that gives these gods their power are their worshipers. So I guess I'll let you choose what you want to be. And I walk off to catch up with the ladies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you guys make out? Was it really fun? Lots of making out there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vax. Vex. Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I understand you have him on your mind. You can't get our names straight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love you a whole lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you still think you're talking to my brother?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know who I'm talking to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Really similar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's the ranger.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you ask him if he's going to help us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who? Vax? Oh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Vax. Is he going to help dig the trench?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I turn around and see him. Is he just standing there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just standing there lost in thought, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Um, hey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, what are you doing? Are you coming to help us, or are you just standing in the middle--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we gotta kill a dragon tomorrow. We gotta kill a dragon. What do you need?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to help build, I don't know, a trench? Set a trap?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I'm really weak, but I think I can use a shovel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What time is it? We haven't even started digging the trench yet? What fucking time is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For you guys, at this point, it'd probably be mid-afternoon, late afternoon. Percy. I need you to go ahead and make three tinkering checks for me, if you don't mind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first one is using your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's intelligence modifier plus proficiency bonus plus tinkering?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, proficiency bonus is what you get with tinkering.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, initial designs and describing with your lackeys, for lack of a better term, that are helping you develop these springs, you manage to explain, lay out, and develop the proper materials, the process, and they seem to acknowledge and understand what you're trying to do, and you guys begin the work. Second check is going to be with your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, baby.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one can help him on these things?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You spend the better part of the day helping them take the metal, strengthen it, bind it, pulling it into the springs that are required. You complete one, you get partway through the second one. Make a final check if you don't mind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With dex?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is also with dex, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 23.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's the dexterity, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So yeah, that's right, 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do take a point of exhaustion through the work that will consist throughout the next day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. What does a point of exhaustion do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on ability checks. So, essentially, any skill checks or ability checks you make-- not attacks or saves, but ability checks you make for the next 24 hours will be at disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he work all the way through the night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this is just the physical activity involved in getting it done in that short period of time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just double-checking, because I have no brain currently, dice roll, dex modifier, proficiency bonus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just because I have no brain, dex modifier, proficiency bonus, dice roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're good, you got it. As you guys find yourselves resting for tomorrow's trap incursion and hopeful defeat of Umbrasyl, we will take a break for the rest of you and come back here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, god! There's more we have to do!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay, we'll do it during the break.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. So, as you're preparing for this, what else do you guys need to do before the morrow?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I dig a trench.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you dig the trench.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want it to be far away to where there's a tunnel and then make a circle around it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to get Fassbender into the middle where the treasure's going to be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk Fassbender out and I lay him down on his back, face-up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to do some stage-setting here. We have to set the scene.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as a note, when you return to Willhand's house, Fassbender and Willhand were both ejected from the doorway. Fassbender doesn't fit in that large room and wrecked part of the staircase from underneath but is fine. As soon as you acknowledge Fassbender to start moving, Fassbender, who has been inert this entire time, since left there for the evening before, takes a step and the area where the crack that you sealed earlier reopens. It looks like there is a minimal magical effect that was more of a cosmetic effect in the healing, but being a construct, it does not actually heal damage from it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Can I go ahead and take this time to do--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm walking Fassbender out to where Keyleth is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (stomping) Fassbender follows you out to that area of the town. As night has come now, the sun has gone, you guys are working in darkness. What are you guys doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Vex, can I have one of your arrows? I want to make it real special.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're speaking my language.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so I grab one of her arrows and I cast Glyph of Warding on one of her arrows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many arrows can you do that do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think just one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt's checking his e-mail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Within an object that can be closed, such as a book, scroll, or treasure chest. So yeah, it would have to be on something that, like a doorway or--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a treasure chest? If-- can you cast it in like a barrel that he's going to break open?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks. I really enjoyed the idea of that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I thought it was going to work. It was going to be real cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. For glyphs inscribed in a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or standing on the glyph, removing another object covering the glyph, approaching within a certain distance of the glyph, so you could place this in theory on the ground near where the treasure's being left and give it the specific trigger for it to go off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It can be maybe in a chest above Fassbender, 'cause he's going to be buried, and then it can be triggered maybe when the dragon lifts it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What exactly does it do, the Glyph of Warding?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can choose explosive runes--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: An explosive rune.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, so it, (explosion). That's cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything within a 20-foot-sphere radius around it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 20 feet is really big. Oh my god! You know what you could do? You could make a trigger if he gets a certain height off the ground, and that way if he's over 20 feet above the ground, then it triggers and he's the only thing that would get affected.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it triggers as a glyph, so whatever's near the glyph would be affected.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So can we hide it in the loot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, you can definitely choose some sort of a small chest or the ground underneath the loot if you want to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I'll find something in the loot, some little chest or something that I can put it in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and what's your trigger?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: When he gets-- if he starts to fly away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So if a creature-- the trigger would be, if a creature--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pulls the glyph up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you. What would you like the trigger to be?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Specific.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If he removes something on top of it. But also if he grabbed it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if it gets above a certain feet in the air? Can it trigger then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can say if a creature flies above it at a certain height it can trigger. I'll give you that, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. So if it flies--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it flies 20 feet above it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it meant if the glyph lifted in the air.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll make that one of the triggers if you want it to be lifted. So, if the glyph is lifted by a creature--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So it can't be if he just touches it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could do that, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it might be better if he lands and then we spring the trap. It could be a thing, if he tries to leave it explodes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If he tries to leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, if the object is lifted off the ground, it triggers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Even like this much? If it's just moved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and you're doing explosive rune. What type of damage?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to do cold damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I know, is a black dragon-- does it have any weaknesses?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would know, with your knowledge and specialization, it does not have any weaknesses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It has no weaknesses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is immune to acid damage, of course. But that is the only real information you have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to go cold damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cold damage. All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Fassbender? Is he immune to any damage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm pretty sure he's immune to most kinds of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's hitting and slicing. I'll check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to cast it at fifth level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fifth level? All right. That brings it to 7d8 cold damage. And what's your spell DC?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we lose Fassbender--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's expendable. Hopefully he survives. If not, good cause.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we fuse some chains into Fassbender so that he can be attached to the ground?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can. Can I do that? Right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Using what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to take and cast a Stone Shape spell, and then I want to open and almost make him a chain harness that's embedded into his waist? And then while I'm at it, can I patch him up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stone Shape is instantaneous. So whatever you want to do, it happens immediately. So, essentially, you could, with one casting of Stone Shape, seal the wound. With another casting of it you could then go ahead and have the chains--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ready to go (squishing).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many chains are you embedding in it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two big ones?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two big chains? Okay. So you get two of the heaviest chains that you can find, which you probably got from the prison.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, well, how about this? Vax, Vex, grab a chain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. These are heavy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, ready? On my go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, where are we putting it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay? I'm going to make a spot and just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You take left. I'll take right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ready?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As she does that, suddenly the chest wound opens up into these two big cavities. You take the chain edges and put them inside as they seal around them. There's now these two giant, heavy, door-holding chains that are now dangling for about 70 feet on each end from his abdomen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where do we attach these chains to? The ground?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One to the ground. Put the other one in a goliath's hands with a harpoon or a hook on the other end. Snag our prey, and then we have a Fassbender hanging from the bottom of a dragon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can find some metallic hooks just through general construction materials in the town if you want to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we should do ten or 15 feet to the ground of chain and ten or 15 feet to the dragon, so that it's, thunk, and he's caught on the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we'll sever the chains with Grog's muscles. We need to get 'em the right distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About how long?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten feet into the ground, which we can--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it right now. Ready? I'm going to do another Stone Shape spell into the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Otherwise, it's just earth that's pulling it. Go ahead and roll a survival check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not bad. What's my survival? 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24, okay. You take some time. It's about 60 feet out from where the drop point is, is the nearest piece of near-surface stone. It's about 15 feet beneath the surface, but it is viable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Negative. I will cast--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why can't it be 15 feet below the surface?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But he's going to go up like a kite now because it's going 60 feet all the way over there, where stone is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to burn-- I did that earlier, but I'm going to burn my last 5th-level spell to do Transmute Rock again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you said there was dirt? All right, let's dig a little bit of a hole real quick. So we dig a hole ten feet down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Transmute. Turn it into rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and with that, the earth-- Okay, what is the radius of that one there? Let me see.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to cover this up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With dirt?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And treasure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Now you have Fassbender just there, stuck to the ground with the chain at its side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fassbender, lie down. Lie down?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take my last little bit of Stone Shape residual energy and take that mustache Vax drew on--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stone Shape does not--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And make the mustache permanent that he drew on with charcoal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, I'll let that slide. With the remnants of the spell magic fading, the now-lying-down Fassbender staring up with his vacant sunken blue-glowing eyes towards the night sky and the stars above, your hand reaches across the face, and with that suddenly the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like this, I want to keep it, there we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --the once-charcoaled curly mustache recedes into the face, carved permanently to his face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: High-five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give Keyleth a very soft high-five, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Isn't that cool?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll probably bruise tomorrow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. It's cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go to Keyleth and ask if I can borrow the rod of immovable rodness. How big is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like that long. It's like the rung of a ladder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's got a little button on the side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Button on the side? Cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like a Tron lightbike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When are we going to set the trap that Percy made?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As soon as he finishes it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we should set the stage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In theory, it has to be laid down underneath all the treasure so that it just is nothing, and then we put everything on top, and then basically it's set, and then pins get pulled so that it's set. And you don't disturb shit again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Percy, we're ready to fly in the trap whenever you are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, let's do that, gentlemen. Let's move it. Good work, ladies and gentlemen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While you guys set the trap, I'm going to turn into a raven. My job is done here. I'm going to just go and circle while they're setting the trap and setting the stage and do patrol and make sure we're not being watched.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why this creepy music?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's random, guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why is he doing his eyebrows up and down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because the fucking dragon's going to see us right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, sorry. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So far, nothing seems to have caught your attention that's out of the ordinary. About half an hour passes before you see a group of civilians, along with Percy, wheeling on carts this large ramshackle construction made of support beams from houses, metal joints that were used as basic construction elements, as well as these large metallic springs on multiple sides with hooks and elements of a chain-based net that has been piecemealed together. Eventually you guys bring it over. You clear out the area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fassbender will lay on top of the trap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fassbender will lay on top of the trap?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right? He can't lay under the trap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well if it's like a mousetrap, can't he lie in between it? Taliesin, how does it work?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's just keep him right off to the side because if that trap triggers--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In theory, he should be able to fit right at the sides of it, because it's got an armature spring system. As long as you're not in the way of the armatures, you should be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you set it up and away, laying the sides down, precariously putting the pins in, holding it in an open position. You begin to take dirt, dust, and gathering up the area, trying to hide it to the best of your ability. Who is in charge of camouflaging this piece?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go ranger, go ranger, go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Which dice will I use? There's no way to choose."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I aid her in this bit of camouflage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to sing me some inspiration?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I inspire her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, what do you want to sing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) R-r-ranger, turn and face the strange! R-r-ranger, looks like you're going to have to hide this shit! Time may save me, but I hope you-- also do-- (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31. You guys take a good portion of the next hour or so, under her guidance and tutelage, hiding this entire trap, getting dirt, the top layer of sand to cover it so it looks like it hasn't been recently disturbed--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Little Dust of Tracelessness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Killed. Buried beneath the surface, just to the point where he's pretty much flush with the ground of where it is. Contraption set, the objects placed back inside with some of the barrels and some of the leftover pieces of wood, the one overturned cart. You go ahead and take the chest and you place the glyph onto it. It takes a while to cast that spell, about an hour, but you complete it without an issue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make it look like there's treasure on it. I take some of the gold that we have and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Place it onto it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A thin layer, where it looks like a lot of gold but it's really just a thin layer of gold over top of rocks.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If it's a chest, can we put some coins sticking out of it? So it looks like it's full?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that. It does cost you about 200 gold worth of components to do this glyph, so mark off that from your personal gold supply.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Question. We sort of thought maybe we could use Kevdak as a tribute, like we sacrificed him to the great shitty Umbrasyl. Is that his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Umbrasyl, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it doesn't quite have the same effect without his head. Do you still have that head? In fact, I think I might have the head. Did I put it in my bag of cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did, I believe. You gave it to her to put in there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would that be all right with you, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you want to kill this dragon, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want that head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have the head. I only have the gross bear tattoo off Kevdak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right, I put the flayed skin. I don't have the head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, I can tell when you're lying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't have the head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're lying. Grog, can we maybe-- you'll be able to get it back, because we're going to kill this dragon and then you can just go and pick up the head and keep it again in your Bag of Holding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the head for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can make it seem like we sacrificed Kevdak to the dragon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if you sacrifice me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, what?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, use me as bait!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'd have to chop off your head.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we could just tie him to a chair or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or I could just put my hands behind my back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Make it look-- wrap some rope to make it look like it's loosely tied.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if he bites and kills you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I don't know, but it's better live bait than dead, right? At least when you fish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty sure that's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to be bait, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that sound fun to you, or--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's exploding things around here. Are you sure you want to be in this area?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, you don't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) No, I don't. I will give you the head of Kevdak.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, it took a look from Pike!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, that's a powerful look.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want it back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You'll get it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You better promise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I promise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. You can have it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: With a bow on it. You'll get it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want a bow on it! He didn't ever wear a bow!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, I'm just saying you'll get it back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's still got flesh on it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's a little soft, but it works. So you have the head of Kevdak at your disposal. Trap is set. Percy, who's pulling the pins, what's the trigger mechanism?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The trigger mechanism is any weight shift. It's the same as a mousetrap. It's like you put pressure on it, you take pressure off of it, doesn't matter. As long as there's immediate weight shift in the platform, where the booty is, it just goes snap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So very carefully and very precariously, you all have set this trap as the final element, aside from the camouflage. Is there anything else you would like to add with this very sensitive large situation being finished?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we hiding?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to hide in the trenches, yes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It depends on where you want to hide, I guess. (caws)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as I'm within range for my guns, I'm going to hide way off in the treeline.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, there were two trees that were 80 feet? Or 60?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, Ryan, can I get the box of tree materials? Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, that box of trees that you have.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are we near any structures or any houses?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to put it into perspective here, the glyph lies over in this area. Most of the treasure's been placed in that area. The trap we'll say is set about in that area, with the central piece being the triggering mechanism.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the trench is all around that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The trenches are down in this area. Oh, now you say the trenches, are you saying they're covered or not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They are covered.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where is the opening for the tunnel? Where would you like it to be?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Far away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There, on the other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This side over here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Make it 50 feet at the most.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want it to be more than that, I'd like it to be 100 feet away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want them to get there in one turn, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to be able to get there right away on surprise attack, spring right out of the ground as soon as that trap triggers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In theory, if the trap is sprung it'll make enough ruckus that anyone in those trenches should hear it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, but it's more about the proximity of the exit to the trenches.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, what I'm thinking is I've got a circle that I've carved around it. And then there's like a tunnel that shoots off this way and there's an entrance that they can walk in and get into their places.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want them to just burst out, then?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've made it really thin like I did before, carved it nice and thin--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the entrance is back here, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know what that means.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought we were all filing out of one hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what I was getting at beforehand. The intent is for them to push up and out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Unless you guys think it would be better?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I feel like they've gotta burst out, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was confused.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's going to be cool, like night of the living dead-style! Orcs coming out of the ground! In my mind, it's really awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In your mind, so many things--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. All right. We have entrenched areas in this vicinity with you around it. What's the last things you need to prepare before the evening is done?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to have a feast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It says in the rogue section that longsword is something that I'm proficient in, but there's a rule somewhere that I can't find that says I can't use that for sneak attack? On page 95, it says I'm proficient in longswords.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But somewhere else that I'm unaware of-- no surprise, motherfucker?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The attack must use a finesse or ranged weapon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So it's not a finesse weapon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A longsword, I believe, is strength.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, wait! This longsword was being used as a finesse weapon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It has been used?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or it could be used as a finesse weapon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aloha.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aloha!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In Hawaii, the longsword is a finesse weapon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a beautiful view out this window.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just want to know in advance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say-- stretching it thin. We had agreed it was a finesse weapon for use, meaning as a dex-based modifier for you to use in combat specifically. When did this discussion happen, I'm trying to recall?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've obviously been using it as a dex-based sword, but-- I don't remember if that was specifically for me, or--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a tough decision. But you know, it's not a tough decision to subscribe to Loot Crate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would not be able to sneak attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lovely. I'm going to take off my Boots of Haste and my cloak. See if anyone else wants it, and I'm going to start attuning-- Can you use this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Circlet. Would you be able to control Fassbender?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Instead of shooting arrows?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, Keyleth said you just say "zap," and he just does it until you tell him to stop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it takes your concentration, so it takes--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it takes an action to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm trying to speak in character, all right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do your Boots of Haste do and what does your cloak do, out of curiosity?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Haste will let you double your speed, you'll be able to do one more thing when you're doing things. Scanlan showed me some sort of potion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm assuming that was a Potion of Haste.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I gave the Potion of Haste to Grog. We both found these two potions. Grog has the Potion of Haste if anyone else desperately needs it, and I certainly don't need to be any smaller, so I've given the potion of reduction? Reducement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Diminution.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Diminution? To good old Vax here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's funny, because part of my idea was to go in with you. But I know that you have to do it to folk of your own size, but if I were little Vax, I could go with you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why can't you keep your boots on for that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Honestly, spellcasters, it's not as beneficial for us to have Haste.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's true, but I'm wondering if anyone wants Fassbender. If I'm going in, I'm not going to be able to concentrate on that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, depends on when you're going in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't know. Give it to Vex.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you focus on Fassbender and tell him to just attack or to cast Slow, he will do that until that dragon is dead. He will just continue without you having to focus on him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know. I just don't want to miss a shot to go into the belly of the beast with my little buddy here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so trite.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We were born to do this!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it have to be attuned?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So if you already have three objects attuned, you'd have to take one off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I can't wear the circlet, dude.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I'll wear it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could, definitely. If you could take the Haste Potion then I might take the boots, because speed would not be a terrible thing for me to have because then I get to shoot more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to take this sword and I'm going to leave the Deathwalker's Ward on, that can't come off anymore, and the circlet, so the boots are up for borrowing and the Displacer Cloak is up for borrowing. Displacer Cloak makes you very hard to hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the haste will Haste you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does the cloak do, again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on physical attacks against you. Until you get hit, and then once you get hit, it fails to work for a turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I might take that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The cloak?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Oh my god, I'm going to take the belt off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to lose your beard!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know that! This shit's in there tight. I take the Belt of Dwarvenkind, and I put it in the Bag of Holding. I put the Displacer Cloak on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You will be losing 26 hit points to your maximum hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Wait! Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your constitution-- or no, it's plus two, so you'd be losing 13 hit points on your max hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never mind, no. Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because your constitution will go down without it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can take off my Bracers of Archery, too, and put something on--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do those do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They just give me a plus two to damage rolls.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're wearing a cloak, so if you wear the boots, you can click them and you've got more movement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Give me the boots. I'm putting the boots on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Boots of Haste?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then I'll take the cloak, I guess. I'm going to take off my spell slot ring. And I put my goodie but my oldie circlet on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's have a feast! Let's have a feast!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys prepare for the evening. You make your way back to town. Where are you having your feast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Isn't there a central place that we killed Kevdak at?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The mayor's? The big mansion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whatever that place is called.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Margrave's house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all war-painted up, you can see there's smears of various dark charcoal and/or crimson liquid smeared across them in patterns. There is a brimming tension of coming battle. You may do your Heroes' Feast if you wish. You can feast up to 12 creatures as part of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can also do a feast if I cast it at seventh level. But, fuck it, I'm going to sleep, so it doesn't matter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to do two feasts?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike and I are both going to cast Heroes' Feast, so that way we can feast 24 people total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So tell Kevdak. Sorry, fuck! Tell Zanror his finest warriors, his druids--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Abjurist Noja.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And Old Davin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And his wife.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So make sure we have Zanror, his wife, his druids that he mentioned; there were like two to three druids?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are there any magic-users in the room?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Magic-users or clerics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Magic-users or clerics.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Abjurist and Old Davin included.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. That being the case. You guys have your meals in the center of town, summoned forth a grand Heroes' Feast, two side by side. The chosen soldiers step up and you all begin to feast upon your meal. The taste is great but you're all distracted as the energies of the divine enchantment of these food items fill your body and steel you against the coming fear, there is still the concentration in your eye as you all look off listlessly in the distance as you finish your food. It's now just pushing past midnight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone seems to go and find themselves to rest, a tense sleep before them. Anything else you wish to do before you go to bed?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rise at sunrise? Rise at dawn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, before we do that, didn't you do something that gave us an extra amount of hit points before Kevdak?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have Shield of Faith that I can put on somebody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will that last for 24 hours?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's up to ten minutes. I can do it tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you're thinking of is Aid, and that lasts for eight hours. That's the one that gives the additional hit points he just mentioned.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does the Heroes' Feast give us additional hit points?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 2d10, and you're immune to poison, fear--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As temporary hit points, should mention that too. It's a separate pool. So 2d10 additional hit points. You want to roll, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh jeez. Don't let me fuck this up. Oh, that's not bad. 14.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 14? That's not bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 14 from me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, we'll say the 14 goes to your group, the 12 goes to the rest of them for the purposes of this. So that's a separate pool, the 14 hit points come off first before anything else.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If it's midnight, I would take Aid, just in case he comes in the morning, and if he doesn't, no harm done, you rest up anyway, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Say it one more time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wouldn't mind taking Aid in case he comes in the morning. If eight hours pass I lose it anyway, but you rest up again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want to have it for the night?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just in case he comes in the morning.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, when do we want to be at the trap? Dawn?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At dawn!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, before first light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He comes normally around noon, he said.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we need to be in our places by 5AM.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So each target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by five for the duration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For each level of the spell, so if you cast it at higher levels, it's more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How high do you want to cast it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cast it at-- fifth is the highest that I have now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rock out. Go for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, let's do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five times five?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll lose it when we wake up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, do you want it for tonight?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It'll hold for eight hours, right, or, but I lose it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight hours, yes, but a long rest is eight hours, so.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, it'll go away. Let's wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time of year is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's winter cresting into spring--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so we have long nights right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to go the fuck to sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So let's sleep for a good six hours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six to eight hours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Set our alarm clocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You run on a pretty consistent schedule, being a ranger.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wait until everyone falls still, and then I scrabble over to you. Are you awake? Yeah, you're awake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm staring at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you use your tongues?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're asleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How does she see everything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's a witch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's a witch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's a witch! Did you see the broom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Food is being prepared, cooked, and eaten without a word being spoken between them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just want to make sure that we're going around, passing out all the chains, attaching little hooks and jabby things and grappling hooks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They know the plan. As soon as he lands on the ground, everybody springs up and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone springs up and hooks him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If the trigger for that, they're going to be underground--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The trap should go (snapping).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If they hear a big clank, that's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get up and out. Yeah, regardless.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will they know that that's a big clank?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sure it'll be pretty loud. There might also be an explosion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone's feasted for the morning. We've lost Taliesin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry. His work is done. He made his trap good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like he's on the internet in Hawaii or somewhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right when I wake up, I am going to try Divine Intervention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Hold on just a second.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah man, it's as good a time as any.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it last for a while?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You used it before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, it's never worked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, the guy showed up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's something else.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That wasn't intervention.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought that was Divine Intervention that made the guy show up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's never worked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's one of those things where the effects can range. It can be something that's immediate; it can be something that's more long. Understanding that, acknowledge when would be the good time to use it, whether it be now or later. Depends on what you're requesting, what you're praying for.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To come help us kill a dragon. So that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll a percentile dice, then.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do I have--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll 2d10. You may have a die that has multiple numbers on it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do. Is this the percentile?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Roll that first. What'd you roll?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do I need to roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled an 80.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It never works!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you feel her glow upon you, her warmth and protection guiding you to victory, there is not more within her strength or sphere of influence she can grant you at this time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dammit. I don't feel her warmth, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What else would you like to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just go eat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so the sun has come up, the hour hits to eight, nine in the morning, you're looking at about three hours until the dragon's--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what time is it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Son of a bitch, we overslept.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we've been up since dawn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we were trying to get in places before dawn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we're moving now. It'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hate it when I oversleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The rest of you and the rest of the Herd make your way north. The few people that have stayed behind in the town, the few stalwart, stand outside as you all march by, and they all acknowledge, bow their heads, some get down on their knees and pray for you as you pass. As you quietly make your way outside of Westruun into the plains between the dotted treed landscape towards the drop point. The Herd makes its way under the tunnel beneath the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace on all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are situated. There is the entrance tunnel off to the side that is currently visible and open from that portion. Do you wish to close or hide that tunnel?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going in that tunnel, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan. Where do you want to go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you have hidden--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't want to go underground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we going in a tree?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to go up in a tree. Let's go 200 feet away.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to run up to Scanlan and I'm going to cast Death Ward on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you drop below zero, you come back to one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't need it. I'm okay. I know that you're very worried about me because of our love, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Scanlan, you have Death Ward on you. You are now up in this tree here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't need it. It jinxes me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to cast Protection from Energy, acid, onto Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax actually already has resistance to acid because of his armor.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to cast it onto Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So Vex. Currently you have resistance to acid as long as concentration remains.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also cast Protection from Energy, resistance to acid, on Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you also have resistance to acid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to stay in this cluster of trees with Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan over here, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to be up in a tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to be up in the tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Different tree?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think we should all be in the same tree, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use my perception to see how hidden everything is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say up in this tree. You want to be up in this one over here instead?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, something far.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. You'll be in this one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think Percy wanted to be in a tree, too, at a distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We'll say Percy is over at this one here, watching his trap hopefully spring.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax is with Scanlan. Stuck like glue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Trinket in your necklace?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Where do you want to be? Did you want to cast your Aid spell on anybody before this happens?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, we're more than 150 feet away, yes?

lines.name: LAURA, MATT
lines.text: Some people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like the trees are 80 feet away from the stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like to be more than 150--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 70-ish feet away is right here where these trees are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're about 50-ish feet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to cast Aid on Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At what level?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fourth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's 15 additional hit points to Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Additional or temporary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not temporary, additional. Keyleth, who else?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Scanlan, again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, and--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't you do it on yourself?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I have low hit points. I'll do it on myself. 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, 15.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keyleth, can you help me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you cast it again, or are you just happy with those people? You can cast it multiple times if you have the spell levels for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to save my spells.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to need help. I know a little bit about dragons. I don't know a ton. Can you help my knowledge of animals in any way, shape, or form? For some sort of a check, I don't know. I just want to make sure that I know everything I can know in the moment when checked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can bards inspire themselves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. At higher levels, he can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Theoretically, I could enhance your ability, but it's a concentration spell and I've already protected from acid against Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Never mind. I'm fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does your cloak do? That I put on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Disadvantage on attacking you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like, melee?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Until you get hit, and then it's gone for the round but resets for the next round.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only melee, not spells, yeah?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, at this point in time, Kevdak approaches.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Zanror.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I did it again. Zanror and two of his goliaths stay there waiting, with the offering placed at its designated spot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit. I can't believe we're doing this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Any last-minute preparations?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to-- wait, Grog, where are you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm down in the tunnel.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is that where I am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, wherever you want to be.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to be in the trenches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the trenches? All right, so you make your way into the trenches, pushing past all the rest of the Herd members.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hide the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We'll say for the purposes of this spread so everyone knows where they're all hidden currently--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everyone knows they need to not move at all and be completely--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Quiet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm down over here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, you're in the middle of it? Oh, shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just going to hide. I'm not going to be a hero.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll throw her out of there if something goes wrong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She doesn't clank if she doesn't move.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They'll see me shining with my shiny armor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're right. We need to be stealthy up in the trees.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I come over the earpiece in the calm of battle and I say: if things go terribly wrong, rush to this cluster of trees. I have ways that can get us out. I feel like I should say something inspiring, but I don't have anything, so--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about fuck shit up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck shit up, as Grog once said. About two days ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It woosh-- wraps around, you hear the smashing of metal and wood and low, guttural roaring. Dust has filled the area, and, for a brief moment, you have no visual on what's happened. As soon as that hits, everyone around you in the tunnels bursts through the floor, smashing through as the tunnels begin to collapse inward. Also, I need everybody to go ahead and roll intiative.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did he move the treasure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on meteorite die, don't dick me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Green, lucky jade. That's okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt Colville, this is on you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not you, Liam, it's me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not good. Liam, yours doesn't matter. Mine does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is yours not good?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's okay, we got this. Pike's going to win the fight for us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, can I use Luck for initiative?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What does it say for the ability?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It doesn't matter, Liam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll find out here. It counts as an ability check. I don't see why it wouldn't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're the all-seeing eye.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The feast gives us advantage on all initiative checks, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ability check or saving throw-- technically, you get plus two to ability checks, correct? I'd say, sure, you can reroll initiative if you want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughs) It was the exact same number!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You use the Luck point, and your initiative is what it is. Starting at this point in time, everybody--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have 25 to 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, 22. Vex. The Herd actually rolled really well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good, we need that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. All right, 20 to 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big ten, which if you think about it rounded is like 100.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also big ten, which if you round it twice is like a thousand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Ten to five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Big five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Big five, right there. Scanlan holding up the rear, there we go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gosh, plan B indeed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the top of this surprise round, I need Vex to go first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Am I first?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've got, no, he has Fassbender.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has Fassbender. I guess I'm just going to shoot it. I mean, what else can I do right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You do you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. My Boots of Haste have been clicked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you are now hasted. You may now have an additional attack action per turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Badass. I'm going to Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait. Yeah, because I'm still hidden in the tree, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hunter's Mark on Umbrasyl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to Hunter's Mark him. I'm going to shoot him with my Longbow of the Sky Sentinel. So I'm going to roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Now, he is surprised, so you actually have--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you have advantage because he doesn't see you, so yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so the first one is 12 plus 15 is 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So. Okay, those are regular attack plus lightning arrow attack, right? I all of a sudden forget how it works. Plus 1d6 per arrow. 1d6 for the Hunter's Mark. And then 1d6 on the first one for the sneak attack. Okay. Plus the regular.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Herd's up next, and then Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 31 on the first arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31 damage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven plus five is 12.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 12. Plus nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. You're not getting additional sneak attack for the other two hits, by the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, I know. I lost my-- 18, I think. 18 was the last one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So that was your Sky Sentinel attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was my first attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For my second attack, I'm going to shoot him with one of my dragon arrows. Should I waste it on him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course, he's a dragon! This is it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have two of them. I've been saving one, but I'm going to use one on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is still advantage because it's still surprise round, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. That's still my Hunter's Mark, and then-- I have a Jelly Belly in my thing-- And then that's 10d6 additional damage for the dragon arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, surprise round doesn't give you advantage, but you were hidden from the top of the round, so you have advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. So an additional 10d6 damage for the dragon arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. 6d10. Sorry, my mistake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's going to one-shot the dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 6d10. (counting)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, can I turn around and see Keyleth and Vax making out in the tree behind me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not making out! There's a slow trickle of wizz going down my leg right now, man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm hyperventilating.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. 24 plus ten is 34 plus Hunter's Mark is another four. 38 on that attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 38 points of damage on the dragon-slaying arrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then my third attack, I'm going to use the Blazing Bowstring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just so you guys are aware, this is over 100 points of damage in one round.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enjoy those boots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I still get advantage, because I'm still hidden?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. At this point in time, I'll say you've definitely made yourself known.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically you shouldn't have had advantage on the other ones, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pssh, arrow splinters across the hide, no effect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Staying there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to sink down into the leaves, yes, and try to hide better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no actions to hide, but you're in a tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can't even get in; there's so many of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm trying to duck behind some branches so he doesn't have direct line of sights on me, okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're going to kill us all!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I were near you, I would slap you. Get a hold of yourself, man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Throwing chains up, some of them leap up and jab the actual hook into the side and try to pull back. Having a hard time piercing hide. It's real strong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some of them can try to like swing the grapplings around the ankles--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shh, don't distract him, he's adding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I got this, don't worry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't piss him off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We'll say about eight of them manage to actually get it into the hide. The rest either bounce off or can't find purchase into its hide and it just scrapes down, but the rest of them are trying to hold it down. "We got him! We got him!" And they're holding back. The archers all take aim. Misses, misses, misses, misses, hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Question. Did we give the chain attached to Fassbender to one of the goliaths?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's buried in the stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the stone, but one has to go on the dragon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If that's what we planned, sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't tell Fassbender to use it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, no. Okay. Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's two hits for all the arrows. All the rest of them are just smashing against the hide of Umbrasyl. No effect. That is seven points of damage and eight points of damage. They actually make it through. That's their round. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go into a rage, and I would like to run up behind him with my Bloodaxe and make two reckless attacks against him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's got it. He's got a whole strategy. He's street-smart, this guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Intelligence of three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's really good. 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, that's 23 with three points of necrotic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23, three points of necrotic damage added in or on top of that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's part of it, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And then the second one-- 22 with one point of necrotic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can start seeing that damage is possible, though it's a lot to cut through. This is a very hefty, very old beast. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With my bonus action, could I drink the potion of fast nuts? Potion of speed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, isn't it a bonus action to go into a rage?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I believe you're right. Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty sure it is. Let me double-check real fast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think you're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine, yeah. Bonus action. So that's your turn? Percy, you're up. You're way behind the dragon, hiding by the treeside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to cast Hex on the dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Hex on the dragon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With a disadvantage to all strength checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strength ability checks, okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hold my turn until the dragon's turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're just going to hold until it does something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hold until it does something, and if it does nothing, I'm taking my attacks, and if it gets away I'm taking my attacks. I'm just taking my attacks after him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It fails its saving throw because it is held in there. It is currently considered grappled. It doesn't have disadvantage or anything, but I'll say from this standpoint it can't really move around a lot. It's going to take the damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) What was that face?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Terrible roll. 21 points of lightning damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's 8d6.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of his turn, it's going to use one of its legendary actions to make a tail attack against you. We'll say that'll be 27 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That'll hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I use Cutting Words on the attack or to reduce the attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so 27 to hit. You take, from the slam of its tail behind you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I mean to, I'm sorry, I can't reduce the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I thought, to reduce the

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go for it. Roll your d10.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten. 17. What's your AC?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. With that, the tail-- whack!-- slams into the ground. You manage to push out of the way just in time as Scanlan shouts up to the dragon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi! You're so ugly you entered an ugly contest and they said no professionals! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just enough of a distraction in the settling dirt for the dragon to turn its head over and its tail swings just a little wide of you, Grog, as you sidestep, no effect. We'll say for this, it's less of a surprise round. I use surprise round liberally. Surprise was it grappling and everyone getting out of it and preparing for the actual assault.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's more of a

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Umbrasyl does get a turn. Umbrasyl, very frustrated and angry at the circumstance, is going to attempt to break free. With disadvantage on the athletics check to try and break out of the grapple because of the Hex. All right. That is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that a save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, the strength-- (struggling sounds) cannot seem to break free from the grapple of the communal might of all the goliaths there. So that is unhappy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Meaning Matt is unhappy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And three more dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why the book?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, what are we looking up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's in the book?

lines.name: MATT
